result.execSummary:
The defendant David R Hobl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: to run concurrent and commence immediately

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week.

SAFE Program
LEAP Program
Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the department. 
Court finds the defendant is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 13CF984, filed in 14CF561)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:06 am 
INCLUDES 13CF984 AND 14CF561. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 
VRCW. 

PLEA HEARING IN 14CF561. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 2 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN BOTH FILES. 
State moves to revoke DEOJ in 13CF984 on Ct. 1. COURT grants and enters judgment on Ct. 1 (Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Harm) in 13CF984. 
R.E. makes statement. State makes statement. Atty Jackan makes statement. Def makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: In 13CF984, on Ct. 2 (Battery)>>9 months MCJ with huber for work/counseling if def qualifies under jail criteria with 83 days credit and payment of court costs. 
                           : In 13CF984, on Ct. 1 (Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Harm)>>SWH for 4 years probation to run concurrent and commence immediately - conditions: pay for K.M.H.'s counseling; no contact wtih K.M.H. unless approved by agent; 180 days MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations. 
                           : In 14CF561, on Cts. 2 and 3>>SWH for 3 years to run concurrent and commence immediately. 
COURT ORDERS as conditions of probation in all - SAFE program; LEAP program; assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; payment of court costs including 2 DA surcharges. 
COURT remits DNA surcharges in 13CF984. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit in 14CF561 if revoked. 

Adj: 10:40 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Final pre-trial on September 24, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 14, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Clerk Marisa.

INCLUDES 13CF984 AND 14CF561. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 

ARRAIGNMENT IN 14CF561. 
Information Previously filed. Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
Bond Continues. 

Adj: 11:00 am
Pre-trial conference on August 11, 2014 at 11:10 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:03 am 
INCLUDES 13CF984 AND 14CF561. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 
Date and Time was set for preliminary hearing in 14CF561 and Motion to revoke DEOJ in 13CF984. 
State notes intent to schedule PTC to discuss possible resolution to these cases and requests motion to revoke DEOJ be addressed at a later date. 

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 14CF561. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be filed. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to schedule PTC and arraignment. 
Bond Continues. 

Adj: 9:06 am
Preliminary Hearing on July 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  J.H.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  Third party visitation through Family Resource Center.
